intro: Cybele dareoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with leaves that are rounded and often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including shades of pink, purple, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Cybele dareoides is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
